title: General Settings
text: Quarantine Days This controls the duration between the date of earning loyalty points and the point at which they can be utilized. By setting the value to '0' (zero), customers can use their points immediately as long as they have met the minimum point requirement. Validity Days This refers to the timeframe within which loyalty points remain valid following the quarantine period. A value of '0' signifies that there is no expiration date. Minimum available points before spending In order to redeem their points for purchases, the customer must possess a points balance that is equal to or exceeds a designated threshold. This threshold represents the minimum number of points necessary for redemption. Gift vouchers earns points When this option is activated, customers can accumulate loyalty points for purchases made with gift vouchers. Can purchase gift vouchers with points Enabling this option will allow Gift vouchers to be purchased using loyalty points. Discounted items earn points When the loyalty points feature is activated, reduced-price items will accumulate loyalty points. Web orders earn points Loyalty points will be accumulated for online orders when the feature is activated.

title: Exchange Ratio
text: A relationship between two values, such as loyalty points and rewards, is defined by the exchange ratio, which determines the amount of one value that can be traded for the other. For instance, if the exchange ratio is 100 points to $1, a customer would require 100 points to receive $1 in rewards. To set or add local currencies use the Shop Setup module via Admin. From currency to points This is the number of points accrued per currency unit. In the example above, the customer will accrue 1 loyalty point for every £1 (GBP) spent. From points to currency This is the monetary value of each point. In the example above, a customer with 100 loyalty points has the value of £10 (GBP) to redeem against future purchases.

title: Excluded Shop Groups
text: You can exclude specific shop groups from the loyalty scheme. Choose from the list of shops you want to exclude, or use the search function to find the desired shop.
description: You can exclude specific shop groups from the loyalty scheme. Choose from the list of shops you want to exclude, or use the search function to find the desired shop.

title: Includes Excludes
text: Please select from the drop-down option to specify whether the selected items in this section should be "included in" or "excluded from" the loyalty scheme. Based on the "included in" or "excluded from" rule, please select or deselect the relevant options from the list of Hierarchy Nodes, Vendors, and Items. For larger lists such as items, use the search function to filter the list. To select/deselect all options within a table, use the checkbox in the table header. Use the ‘Save Configuration’ button at the top of the page to save any amendments to the loyalty scheme.

title: Check Customer Points via POS
text: You can verify a customer's total loyalty points and their corresponding monetary value using either the Customer module or the POS (Point of Sale) system. To check loyalty points via the POS, make sure the 'Customer' widget is enabled. For detailed instructions on enabling widgets, please refer to the documentation on Widgets. Once the widget is enabled, you will find the customer widget conveniently located on the left-hand side of the POS screen when you log in as a user. This widget provides you with the necessary functionality to search for customers and access their loyalty points information. Click ‘Search Customer’ to view the customer list to select from. Use the filter option to break down the search if required. When a customer has been selected, the customer details will be displayed in the customer widget on the left-hand side of the POS screen. Loyalty Points and their monetary values are separated into. Available – Points that have completed the quarantine period are now available for redemption. You can use these points to offset the cost of future purchases. Not yet available – Points accrued within the quarantine period are not yet available for redemption. These points can only be redeemed once the specified number of quarantine days, as defined in the scheme rules, have passed since the date the points were accrued. Accruing Points To enable customers to earn points during their shopping experience, you can easily add them to the transaction using the widget before finalizing the sale. The transaction should be partially paid with currency or, if allowed by the loyalty scheme's rules, with gift certificates. The points earned will be calculated based on the amount paid with currency or gift certificates, adhering to the scheme rules. When it comes to redeeming loyalty points for a purchase, the customer must have a sufficient "Available points" total that meets or exceeds the specified "Minimum available points before spending" requirement as outlined in the scheme rules. To proceed with the redemption, you can include the customer in the sale utilizing the "Customer" widget. If the available points fall below the minimum requirement for spending, the POS system will display a relevant message indicating the need for more points. Add items that the customer wishes to purchase. When the sale is ready to be paid for, select ‘Payment’ at the bottom of the POS screen. From the payment options on the right-hand menu, select Loyalty Bonus. Additional Notes If the value of the available loyalty points is insufficient to cover the total value of the sale, an additional payment method will be necessary. This means that the customer will need to provide an alternative form of payment to cover the remaining amount not covered by the loyalty points. In transactions where loyalty points have been redeemed, customers will still accrue loyalty points. However, points will only be accrued for the portion of the transaction value that is paid with currency or, if permitted by the loyalty scheme, with gift certificates. The redeemed portion of the transaction value will not earn additional loyalty points. When loyalty points are redeemed, they will be deducted from the customer's "Available points" total. This ensures that the customer's remaining balance accurately reflects the redeemed points.
description:
You can verify a customer's total loyalty points and their corresponding monetary value using either the Customer module or the POS (Point of Sale) system.


To check loyalty points via the POS, make sure the 'Customer' widget is enabled. For detailed instructions on enabling widgets, please refer to the documentation on Widgets.


Once the widget is enabled, you will find the customer widget conveniently located on the left-hand side of the POS screen when you log in as a user. This widget provides you with the necessary functionality to search for customers and access their loyalty points information.



Click ‘Search Customer’ to view the customer list to select from. Use the filter option to break down the search if required.



When a customer has been selected, the customer details will be displayed in the customer widget on the left-hand side of the POS screen.



Loyalty Points and their monetary values are separated into.

Available – Points that have completed the quarantine period are now available for redemption. You can use these points to offset the cost of future purchases.

Not yet available – Points accrued within the quarantine period are not yet available for redemption. These points can only be redeemed once the specified number of quarantine days, as defined in the scheme rules, have passed since the date the points were accrued.



Accruing Points

To enable customers to earn points during their shopping experience, you can easily add them to the transaction using the widget before finalizing the sale. The transaction should be partially paid with currency or, if allowed by the loyalty scheme's rules, with gift certificates. The points earned will be calculated based on the amount paid with currency or gift certificates, adhering to the scheme rules.


When it comes to redeeming loyalty points for a purchase, the customer must have a sufficient "Available points" total that meets or exceeds the specified "Minimum available points before spending" requirement as outlined in the scheme rules. To proceed with the redemption, you can include the customer in the sale utilizing the "Customer" widget. If the available points fall below the minimum requirement for spending, the POS system will display a relevant message indicating the need for more points.



Add items that the customer wishes to purchase.



When the sale is ready to be paid for, select ‘Payment’ at the bottom of the POS screen.



From the payment options on the right-hand menu, select Loyalty Bonus.



Additional Notes

  • If the value of the available loyalty points is insufficient to cover the total value of the sale, an additional payment method will be necessary. This means that the customer will need to provide an alternative form of payment to cover the remaining amount not covered by the loyalty points.
  • In transactions where loyalty points have been redeemed, customers will still accrue loyalty points. However, points will only be accrued for the portion of the transaction value that is paid with currency or, if permitted by the loyalty scheme, with gift certificates. The redeemed portion of the transaction value will not earn additional loyalty points.
  • When loyalty points are redeemed, they will be deducted from the customer's "Available points" total. This ensures that the customer's remaining balance accurately reflects the redeemed points.
